_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The right and wrong conditions [an10.177: Someone who kills living creatures, steals, and commits sexual misconduct
They use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical
They’re covetous, malicious, with wrong view
They survive feeding on the food of the hell beings
The gift does not aid the one who lives there
Different types of people and their rebi: Someone else who kills living creatures and has wrong view
Someone else who doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or use speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical
Someone else who doesn’t kill living creatures and has right view
They're reborn in the animal realm
They're reborn in the human realm
They're reborn in the company of the gods
They're reborn in the ghost realm
They survive feeding on the food of the beings in the animal realm, human realm, or ghost realm
The gift does not aid the one who lives there
Different types of gifts and their effec: Giving to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting
They were reborn in the company of elephants
They were reborn in the company of horses
They were reborn in the company of cattle
They were reborn in the company of dogs
They were reborn in the human realm
They were reborn in the company of the gods
They get to have food and drink, garlands and various adornments, or the five kinds of human/heavenly sensual stimulation
It’s never fruitless for the donor.
